ExtendableCookieChangeEvent.summary: The ExtendableCookieChangeEvent interface of the {{domxref("Cookie Store API", "", "", "nocode")}} is the event type passed to event fired at the when any cookie changes occur which match the service worker's cookie change subscription list. A cookie change event consists of a cookie and a type (either "changed" or "deleted").

remarks.para: Cookie changes that cause the ExtendableCookieChangeEvent to be dispatched are:

ExtendableCookieChangeEventChanged.summary: The changed read-only property of the interface returns any cookies that have been changed by the given ExtendableCookieChangeEvent instance.
ExtendableCookieChangeEventChanged.value: An array of objects containing the changed cookie(s). Each object contains the following properties:

ExtendableCookieChangeEventDeleted.summary: The deleted read-only property of the interface returns any cookies that have been deleted by the given ExtendableCookieChangeEvent instance.
ExtendableCookieChangeEventDeleted.value: An array of objects containing the deleted cookie(s). Each object contains the following properties:

ExtendableCookieChangeEventExtendableCoo.summary:
The ExtendableCookieChangeEvent() constructor creates a new object
which is the event type passed to event fired at the when any cookie changes occur which match the service worker's cookie change subscription list.
This constructor is called by the browser when a change event occurs.

blockquote.para: This event constructor is generally not needed for production websites. It's primary use is for tests that require an instance of this event.
